title: Entertainment Live: 18 May 2015 - BBC News
summary: pitch perfect 2 storms to top of us box office .
taylor swift up eight billboard music awards .
period dramas set for queen victoria and bronte sisters .

documents.title: so long , farewell
text: that 's it for today 's entertainment live page , but we 'll be back tomorrow with all the latest entertainment , arts and culture news .
thanks for getting in touch to let us know where you stand on '80s movies - there is clearly still a lot of love around for the classics .
personally , it 's dirty dancing all the way ( with footloose , flashdance and girls just want to have fun not far behind ) .
author: Sarah Jane Griffiths
Entertainment reporter

documents.title: bradley suffers for his art
text: actor bradley cooper has revealed he has to hang upside down on an inversion table to straighten his back after playing joseph merrick on stage in the elephant man .
cooper shunned prosthetics for the role and plays the physically deformed merrick by contorting his body instead .
the show 's just transferred to london 's west end and cooper told bbc radio 4 's front row twisting his features had left one side of his face bigger than the other .
`` right now my face twitches sometimes , '' he said .

documents.title: toys become art
text: british artist mimsy 's latest project sees classic sylvanian families children 's toys under threat from isis militants .
featuring beach and gay pride scenes , mice-is is intended as a commentary on the threat to freedom of expression isis poses .
the works will be on display as part of the freedom audit exhibition at art15 , which runs at london 's olympia from 21-23 may .

documents.title: aca-scuse me ?
text: while doing the rounds promoting pitch perfect 2 , anna kendrick stopped by to visit james corden on the late late show .

after corden apparently boasted about being the best acapella singer in town , she challenged him to a pitch perfect-style riff-off , with tunes by n'sync , pat benatar and vanilla ice thrown into the mix .

documents.title: inside out reviews
text: the reviews are in for pixar 's latest offering inside out , which has been screening to journalists at the cannes film festival .

it revolves around central character riley , and the five different moods that control her inside her head : ( l-r below ) anger ( voiced by lewis black ) , disgust ( mindy kaling ) , joy ( amy poehler ) , fear ( bill hader ) and sadness ( phyllis smith ) .
he adds : `` no great leap forward this : but slick , smart and funny . ''
the film got five stars from
he even admitted : `` the first tear was rolling down my cheek within 30 seconds flat . ''
the film 's vocal stars were in cannes for a photocall too , including kahling , poehler and smith ( below ) .

documents.title: keith lemon returns
text: keith lemon says he 's `` so chuffed '' itv2 has

it 's after the first series gave the channel its highest-rated launch in two years with one million viewers , and a preview clip of a spoof kim kardashian sketch got more than 7.7 million views on facebook .

the second series will see the return of big fat gypsy kardashians , david dickinson , holly willoughby and the urban fox , plus `` a whole host of brand new and exciting characters '' and celebrity cameos .

documents.title: birmingham library sit-ins
text: library users have been staging sit-ins at the library of birmingham after it switched to shorter opening hours following council cuts .
police were called on friday to help disperse protesters who refused to leave at the library 's new closing time of 17:00 .
on saturday more than 400 people queued through birmingham 's centenary square waiting for the library to open at 11:00 , having previously opened on saturdays at 08:00 .

the library of birmingham , which opened to great acclaim in 2013 , has seen its opening hours slashed from 73 hours a week to just 40 , with the building now closed all day on sundays and every evening .
author: The Bookseller

documents.title: uk reveals eurovision costumes
text: not long to go now before the annual eurovision jamboree kicks off with the first semi-final tomorrow night .
in case you were wondering , the uk gets automatic qualification as one of the biggest financial contributors to the european broadcasting union .
the uk 's hopefuls , electro velvet , have now revealed their costumes for the big final .
it 's probably not very clear from the below , but we 're told they 're `` state of the art led costumes '' that will illuminate in time to their song still in love with you .
the whole eurovision experience has been illuminating for us and we ca n't wait to literally light up on stage in front of the entire world - it 's going to be electric ! ''
the duo said .
rules state only six people are allowed on stage during each act , so electro velvet will be accompanied by four `` backing artists '' who will also be sporting led outfits .

documents.title: ten years of the great escape
text: around 20,000 music fans descended on brighton at the end of last week to help the great escape festival celebrate 10 years of championing new music and catch some of the 450 bands playing across 30 different venues .

acts who played some of their first uk gigs at the event over the past decade , including alabama shakes ( above ) , the cribs ( below ) and secret , last-minute additions the maccabees , the vaccines and drenge , were among those involved in the celebrations .
catch up on everything that happened
or check out

documents.title: acceptable in the '80s
text: ghostbusters , dirty dancing , ferris bueller 's day off - depending on which side of the fence you 're on these films are either awesome or terrible .
guardian columnist hadley freeman has written a book about why she thinks films from the 1980s are better than the movies of today .
freeman says she was taught more about life from watching these films than from books or school and argues pretty in pink and sixteen candles should be put on school syllabuses immediately .
she spoke to today about how current box office hits lack the sort of issues addressed in movies from three decades ago .
listen to the interview
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: the bronte sisters
text: it 's a great day for any period drama fans suffering from poldark withdrawal .
as itv announces new royal series victoria , the bbc has confirmed a one-off drama about the `` tragedy and passion '' of the bronte sisters ' lives .
all three managed to produce great literary works before their untimely deaths - charlotte 's included jane eyre , emily wrote wuthering heights and anne wrote the tenant of wildfell hall .

one drama to walk invisible : the bronte sisters - from last tango in halifax author sally wainwright - will explore the relationships between the sisters and their brother branwell , latterly an alcoholic and drug addict .

documents.title: royal drama
text: queen victoria has inspired a new eight-part tv drama from itv , which starts filming in september .
`` ambitious landmark drama '' victoria will follow the early life of the uk 's longest reigning monarch who ascended the throne at just 18 `` through the eyes of the queen herself '' .
no word yet on who will star in the series , which is from the producers of poldark , but it will be written by novelist daisy goodwin ( the fortune hunter , my last duchess ) .

documents.title: david brent hits the road
text: more details about ricky gervais 's david brent movie have been released by bbc films - with life on the road due to hit cinemas in august 2016 .

set 12 years after the end of the office , paper merchant brent has moved on to selling cleaning products , while never giving up on his dreams of rock super-stardom with his band foregone conclusion .
`` i 'm so excited that the world will see what david brent is up to now and where his future lies , '' says gervais .
`` this film delves much more into his private life than the office ever did and we really get to peel back the layers of this extraordinary , ordinary man . ''
gervais will direct and star in the film as well as writing the script - and some new songs .
but fear not , that old favourite free love freeway will still be making an appearance .

documents.title: hull up for the turner prize
text: it looks like hull 's ferens art gallery will host the turner prize to tie in with the city 's year as uk city of culture in 2017 .
the venue is to get a £ 4.5m upgrade , including a new external glazed lobby to ensure that the artworks in its galleries are kept in the best environmental conditions .
hull city council said : `` this will mean the gallery can attract the very best national and international exhibitions including the turner prize in the future . ''
in 2013 , the prize went to londonderry when it was the first uk city of culture .
author: Ian Youngs
Arts reporter

documents.title: hello europe , nigella calling !
text: celebrity cook nigella lawson is to announce the results of the uk 's televote at the eurovision song contest this weekend .
the star confirmed reports on twitter yesterday .

it 's perhaps a somewhat odd choice of spokesperson , as previous years have seen more musical faces give the result including radio 1 djs scott mills and fearne cotton , blue 's duncan james and former uk entrant cheryl baker .

documents.title: bond films on the thames
text: james bond fans in london received a treat last night after scenes from the upcoming film spectre were shot on the river thames .
production team members apparently told bystanders bond himself daniel craig would be taking part in the scene filmed on a speedboat , but it appeared only a stunt double turned up .

documents.title: weller 's on a different trip
text: paul weller says his 12th solo album , saturn 's pattern , will take fans on `` a different trip , a different journey '' .
he told me : `` it was a question of trying to find something we had n't done before .
there 's that spacey , psychedelic thing to it , but it 's got quite a groovy , soulful r & b thing as well . ''
he also talked about glastonbury , why he steers clear of greatest hits sets and how he 's embracing kale and clean living .
author: Sarah Jane Griffiths
Entertainment reporter

documents.title: cate captivates cannes
text: cate blanchett 's already being tipped for oscar success next year , after critics rushed to praise her and co-star rooney mara 's performances in new film carol .
the film about an illicit lesbian romance in 1950s new york is based on a 1952 novel by patricia highsmith , author of the talented mr ripley .
blanchett has denied speculation suggesting she drew on her own early gay relationships to create the role .
but she added , `` in 2015 , the point should be : who cares ? ''

documents.title: taylor 's awards haul
text: a pretty epic night for taylor swift , who won eight billboard music awards in las vegas last night including top artist , top female artist and the billboard chart achievement award .

she also opened the show with the video for her new track bad blood , before appearing on stage with its stars - singer zendaya , models martha hunt and lily aldridge and actors hailee steinfeld and ellen pompeo - to introduce the first performer of the night , van halen .
the night 's other winners included one direction .
- who won top group and top touring artist .
liam payne tried to put aside those rumours of animosity between the band and former bandmate zayn malick , dedicating their gong to `` our brother , zayn '' .
sam smith won three awards including top male and top new artist , but had to send a recorded message as he 's preparing for surgery on his vocal cords .
pharrell williams , justin bieber and iggy azalea were also winners , while hozier ( above ) won top rock artist and top rock song for take me to church .
british dj calvin harris up top dance/electronic artist - something totally eclipsed in internet-land by the sight of him and taylor swift smooching .
read more on this story .

documents.title: soap awards pay tribute to corrie star
text: stars paid tribute to coronation street actress anne kirkbride at the british soap awards at the weekend .
she was given a posthumous award for outstanding achievement , after being on the soap for 42 years before her death in january .
eastenders was the big winner on the night , winning eight awards including best soap , best actor and best actress for its stars adam woodyat and kellie bright .
the ceremony will be broadcast on itv on thursday 21 may at 20:00 bst .

documents.title: clooney in london
text: george clooney was in london last night for the european premiere of his new film tomorrowland : a world beyond .
the sci-fi adventure , directed by brad bird , was inspired by disney 's futuristic land at their theme parks .
clooney posed for with co-stars hugh laurie - who plays the movie 's baddie - and britt robertson .
he also told the bbc he got into trouble with his mother-in-law last week , after telling the world his wife amal could n't cook .
he said it was a joke between them because she is `` e at other things .
read more of this story .
author: BBC Newsbeat

documents.title: aca-mazing
text: pitch perfect 2 has topped the north american box office in its opening weekend , taking $ 70.3m ( £ 44.7m ) .
it 's a massive total , considering it only cost $ 29m to make and the first pitch perfect film only made $ 65m over its entire run in 2012 .
mad max : fury road opened at number two with $ 44.4m - not bad for a film rated r , which means anyone under 17 can only watch it if they go with a parent or guardian .
the pitch perfect sequel is rated a more free-for-all pg-13 .
here 's the box office top five :

documents.title: get involved
text: as ever we 'd like to hear your views of anything and everything arts and entertainment related .
did you check out mad max this weekend and if so , do you agree with reviewers it 's the best action flick for years ?
did you camp out in london to catch a glimpse of george clooney for the premiere of tomorrowland ?
get in touch and let us know - tweet
author: Genevieve Hassan
Entertainment reporter

documents.title: good morning !
text: hello and welcome to a brand new week , and a shiny new entertainment live page .
we 'll be bringing you the latest from our reporter at the cannes film festival plus news from last night 's billboard music awards and much more from the world of entertainment and arts .
author: Sarah Jane Griffiths
Entertainment reporter
